intro: Stemodoxis, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its thick, woody stems that are often covered in a silvery, powdery coating. The leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a waxy surface that helps reduce water loss. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. This plant is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
